en.target_text: The GSNI is a quantitative measurement tool designed to gauge the effectiveness and efficiency of the 'Illusory Compensation Mechanism' prevalent in modern societies. It does not measure the absolute cost of illusion, but rather the ease of individual access and its transmissibility based on the decline of its real cost measured in gold.
en.hypothesis_text: "The lower the real cost (measured in gold) of Chemical/Digital Illusion tools, the greater their transmissibility and effectiveness as a societal compensation mechanism for the collapse of real economic value."
